intro: Psychotria pachyclada, commonly known as the thick-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
